DataElement.preferredName: Heart Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Echocardiogram Assessment Percentage Lower Limit of Normal Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the lower limit of normal percentage related to the measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction using an image of the heart produced by ultrasonography that provides a comprehensive look at blood flow and the function of the lower chambers of the heart ventricles.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Heart Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Echocardiogram Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction using an image of the heart produced by ultrasonography that provides a comprehensive look at blood flow and the function of the lower chambers of the heart ventricles.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A hollow muscular organ which receives the blood from the veins and propels it into the arteries. It is divided by a musculomembranous septum into two halves -- right or venous and left or arterial -- each of which consists of a receiving chamber (atrium) and an ejecting chamber (ventricle). SYN cor, coeur.

Concepts.definition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).

Property.preferredDefinition: The ejection fraction (or, more correctly, left-ventricular ejection fraction, often abbreviated LVEF) is a measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber. (Wikipedia):An image of the heart produced by ultrasonography.:A physical examination is a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment.

Concepts.longName: Measurement of Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction
Concepts.definition: A measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber.
An image of the heart produced by ultrasonography.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: LVEF Test Percentage Lower Limit of Normal Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: information related to the lower limit of normal percentage of left ventricle ejection fraction.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:The bottom of the normal range for a particular laboratory result.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

The lowest value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
